PEER2025 Program Local Information Contributors

PEER2025 Program

The 4th Workshop on Processing and Evaluation Event Representations (PEER2025) will be held at University of Rochester on April 18, 2025. Both talks and breaks will be held on the top floor of the Rush Rhees Library.

  • 09:00–09:45
    Breakfast

  • 09:45–10:00
    Opening Remarks

  • 10:00–11:00
    Keynote

    Alexis Wellwood (USC)

  • 11:00–11:30
    Coffee Break

  • 11:30–11:50
    Visual Perception and 4-place Event Representations in Preschoolers and Infants

    Ekaterina A. Khlystova (UCLA) , Alexander Williams (UMD) , Jeffrey Lidz (UMD) , Laurel Perkins (UCLA)

  • 11:50–12:10
    Experimentally extracting implicit instruments

    Ashlyn Winship (Cornell) , Zander Lynch (Cornell) , John R Starr (Cornell) , Yifan Wu (Cornell) , Lucas Y. Li (Cornell) ,

  • 12:10–13:10
    Lunch

  • 13:10–14:10
    Keynote

    Ellen Lau (UMD)

  • 14:10–14:40
    Coffee Break

  • 14:40–15:10
    Lightning Talks 1

  • 15:15–15:45
    Lightning Talks 2

  • 15:45–16:15
    Coffee Break

  • 16:15–16:35
    Event Structure Shapes How Humans Summarize Naturalistic Narratives

    Claire Sun (Rochester) , Coraline Rinn Iordan (Rochester)

  • 16:35–16:55
    Understanding Events in Multimodal Data Through Question Answering

    Alexander Martin (JHU) , Kate Sanders (JHU) , Reno Kriz (JHU) , David Etter (Etter Solutions) , Jimena Guallar-Blasco (JHU) , Hannah Recknor (JHU) , Cameron Carpenter (JHU) , Jingyang Lin (Rochester) , William Gantt (JHU) , Benjamin Van Durme (Microsoft, JHU)

  • 16:55–17:15
    Cross-Document Event-Keyed Summarization

    William Gantt (JHU) , Pavlo Kuchmiichuk (Rochester) , Alexander Martin (JHU) , Chihsheng Jin (Rochester) , Angela Cao (Rochester) , Claire Sun (Rochester) , Curisia Allen (Rochester) , Aaron Steven White (Rochester)

  • 17:15–17:30
    Closing Remarks

Legend
